SENT.plain: We used bone marrow biopsies instead of mononuclear cells to maintain long-term cultures from 103 patients belonging to all five sub-categories of myelodysplastic syndromes (MDS), as well as 12 normal controls
By week 4, 30-50% confluency was reached and could be maintained for up to 12 weeks with 100% confluency
The four prominent cells were fibroblasts, macrophages, endothelial cells and adipocytes
Immunohistochemical and electron microscopic studies provided lineage confirmation
Normal hematopoiesis was well supported by MDS stroma
Neither the FAB nor cytogenetics was co-related with the potency of growth
MDS stroma appears to be both morphologically and functionally normal
